review_blob: Kinda flat, but otherwise this is a great cocoa porter...they have managed to avoid the common problem of cloying sweetness and have a well balanced flavor between the burnt malts and the chocolate...very enjoyable
beer_name: Boulder Beer Old Chicago Black Diamond Chocolate Porter

review_blob: This is a surprisingly great porter..dark dark body, nice mocha colored lacing...lots of coffee in both the nose and flavor, combined with some burnt Malta and tailing off to a milk chocolate finish...very smooth body...just good.

Trying the RB Droid app...not much head on a very floral nosed  golden beer...was kinda flat overall...not much malt at all (which I kind of prefer in an iipa) and a very oily mouthfeel...very drinkable and not overly bitter.

Thanks to boamr for sharing. Aroma and appearance are both great but the flavor leaves a little short. All the coffee and chocolatein the nose dont really translate into the taste but the mouthfeel is also great. Too bad they stopped making this

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Thanks to boamr for this. The only complaint for this beer is the flatness. The balance is as perfect as it can be with the cherries adding the tartness to compliment the sours. The residual taste is a little oily which I thought was odd but not nearly enough to take anything away for me.

Slightly cloudy golden color soft white head. Massive sour nose.  The brett is literally jumping out of the glass in both the nose and flavor. The guy at bottleworks said it was peaking and didnt exaggerate at all. The sour is mouth puckeringly intense buts smoothes out into a clean finish

Thanks to dmac for this. Aroma and appearance were perfect. Totally opaque with nice lacing. Flavor is amazing lots of chocolate lots os hops. I cant really describe the mouthfeel. Sooo smooth and velvety. Perfect in almost every way
A lot of citrus in the nose and flavor. The malts are absent from the backbone point of view. Shouldnt be called a double.

This was essentially a Mephesophiles clone from beginning to end. Lots of anise in the nose. Smelled like a giant twizzler. Ther is a lot of abv which will brobably age over time. Would love to try this again in 3 years
Looks smells and tastes like a cup of black coffee with a little bit of beer in it. Probably the best beer in a can I have ever had. I could drink this all day
Thanks to pineypower for this one. Smell was a liitle odd lots of yeast in the typical ommegang fashion. Graet flavor. Spices were solid and and well balanced. I love ommegang

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Odd. Smelled like a sour and tasted like a sour. Looked like a porter with no head. The thing I loved about this was the chocolate that sweetened up the tail

I had a whole case of this but just getting aroiund to rate thius now. Very nice even 5 years in. A liitle bit of cardboard but also a lot of caramel and chocolate in the flavor. Felt like a solid barley wine that was aged to a little bit past its prime

The aftertaste on this stands out the most for me. Ver bitter and oily. The hops are dominant the entire time from the nose to the taste but overwhelms everything else and lingers on the end of the mouthfeel
beer_name: Cigar City Improv Imperial Dark Rye Ale

review_blob: Dark brown with lots of head. Very toasty aroma lots ot nuts and chocolate. Odd flavors a lot of nuts and toasted grass. Can taste the abv and has a warming mouthfeel. This could have aged a bit but good nonetheless
Awesome flavor. Essentially a chocolate milk stout. Smooth aned creamy mouthfeel
Awesome flavor. Lots of caramel with a perfect balance. Knowing how old this is made me appreciate it even more

Unbelievabe from the first whiff massive sour nose with the sweet undertones or the raspberries. Perfectly balanced between the funk and the fruit. The sourness lingers in the aftertaste but agin there is just enought sweetness tokeep it from being mouthpuckeringly bitter.

Very sweet aroma. Obviously a ton of hops which made it onterting to me that it wanst more bitter than it turned out to be. Also surprisingly absent was the slick oily mouthfeel which for me was a serious plus.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: This is supposed to be an autumn seasonal? No spices, no caramel malts. Just an over hopped mess that tastes hauntingly like a lot of other magic hat beers, with nothing special about it. This was about as far from an amber as an amber is from a stout,imo. Can someone please tell magic hat that every beer they make doesnt need a thousand pounds of hops per ounce.

If this was supposed to be balanced, it wasnt. A lot more hops than I was expecting and an odd almost gritty kind of mouthfeel. Didnt have the malts I was looking for in the background. I was sad this wasnt better

poured cloudy brown, almost the color of a grocery bag, a little fit of fizzy carbonation. flavor was sweet, but you could definitey feel the lean towards the hoppy side of the BW spectrum. the aftertaste was unpleasant, very bitter...i was waiting for the sweetness of the malts to kick in, but they never did.
the epitome of alcopop...massively sweet raspberry flavor...just a big sugary mess with nothing else there...felt more like i was drinking a soda than a beer.

lots of piney hops in the nose and even more in the flavors...there were no malts to make a backbone behind massive amounts of hops...if this were labelled as a standard IPA my score (and opinion) would have been much higher, but for a double there should have been alot more balance.
beer_name: Moylans Hopsickle Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: lots of coffe and hops in the aroma, pour was a nearly solid brown with thin foamy head.  flavor was lots of coffee and very hoppy for a stout. tail end was a little bit harsh..overall i thought it was a little too bitter for my stout likings
beer_name: Olde Burnside Highland Piper Tartan Ale

review_blob: pretty boring, not alot going on. i swear there was a bit of smoke going on in there somewhere, which i never recall having in a bitter before.  it did have a nice crisp taste, and it wasnt bad, but i wouldnt care either way if i had it again.
deep yellow and cloudy, not really even tranparent. very sweet, some grapefruit, some bubblegum...a bit watery and not that spicyness that i like in a Hefe.
Gold no head.  Awesome swwet head nothing to complain about not the texture of a jadwiga but easily a supeior flavor and no stupid flowers
beer_name: Bethlehem Brew Works Biere De Pharaoh

review_blob: cloudy copper pour, little bit yeasty in both the nose and flavor. some pine, very crisp mouthfeel. more bitter than i was expecting, but a smooth crisp beer nonetheless.
beer_name: Cricket Hill Colonel Blides Cask Ale

review_blob: Jet black nice tan head, chioc and wood lot of vanilla nice and sweet with the bourbon in the back...definitely needs toi be warm...real good one it got to the riht temp
beer_name: Bethlehem Brew Works Bourbon Imperial Stout

review_blob: pale yellow body, thought there should have been more head. aroma and flavor both packed with apple, banana, and spices. very sweet finish, very smooth the whole way though.

poured cloudy gold, tons of spices in the nose, along with some citrus sweetness. flavor was very spicy with hints of carame and a little bit of medicine..crisp finish, medium body...an interesting beer to try, not sure if i would want lots

Tan head, bronze, lots of caramel in the nose, very sweet, lots of bourbon and vailla in the tail, lots of caramel and grass in the body, a little warming, could stand some time out of the barrel to age
Poured a nice bronze color with a big white head a lot darker than I thought it would be. Lots of sweetness and a very smooth finish  I enjoyed it quite a bit.

An average at best octoberfest. Smelled like wet grass and pale lager. Color was nice but there was practically no head. Flavor was essentially a slightly spiced pale lager. Bit of a dissapointment from bells

so much better than the 12...alot smoother and better blended in the flavors between the beer and the whiskey...same flavors, wood, whiskey, burnt, and chocolate with hints of molasses and anise, but everything about this one is more enjoyable.

bottle number 25701/sep 07, smells and looks great, deep black color and soapy white head, smell was whisky, and burnt...not sure what the deal with the flavors were...lots of burnt wood...tastes like they pureed a burnt matchstick in whiskey and not much else...i have 3 more of this lineup to drink and hope it improves as i work my way up in numbers.

everything about this screams porter, right up to the point that the anise and hops kick in at the end...almost like a foreign stout with the sourness in the tail...lots of burnt malt and chocolate up until that point that i enjoyed...just not sold on the close

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: thanks boamr for bringing this over, smell was amazing...could actually smell this  from 8 inches away...amazingly well balanced..the pine from the rye comes out huge in the tail and really balances off the hops...i love the way the flavors blend so smoothly...nothing really wrong with this beer that i could note.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Blue Dot Double IPA

review_blob: pretty cloudy rose color, smell is sweet, spices and the obvious floral notes...nice flavor but finishes a little bit bland. this could easily have been a big flowery mess, but is instead a very smooth drinking beer.

huge white fuzzy head, coloudy pale yellow, lots of apple and wheat in the nose.  flavor starts off like a sour and turns cleanly into a what beer...great balance, nice finish..not nearly as tart as the 1809.  thanks boamr
Never saw this before so gave it a try at happy hour. It was a litlle hoppy on the aftertaste but the front end was sweet and packed with caramel malts. I would definitle drink this over the lager.

Thanks for sharing to boamr. So smooth for an unblended. Copper color with the vinegar aroma that gave me the memory off other amazing cantillon beers. Sourness is smooth atthe same time. Another amazing beer fron these people.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Smells and looks like a SA triple bock bit is much better in terms of flavor and the smoothness. Lots of soy and chocolate and bourbon. 08 bottle so it actually had some carbonation instead of being flat.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Odd to me that this is an american strong ale. If I were drinking this blind, based on the color aroma and flavor I would call it a porter. Lots of chocolate and carmel. Head faded down fast and left a lacing ring. Very smooth and great flavor
A lot of sweetness in the flavor. Very smooth mouthfeel. The bith came out of the hops and the wood is a very pleasnt undertone
poured a cloudy copper, aroma was yeast and a little bit of caramel.  flavor was yeast, spice and alcohol...basically, this was a big yeasty mess and not a very good beer.

poured a root beer color with a huge off white head, the retention time of which was excellent, sweet and grassy flavors made the rye readily apparent and the wet grassy flavors came in late to balance out the sweetness. i thought it was a very nice balance and a very drinkable beer

note that this rating is being posted a good 3 years after i drank it....Walt sent some of these up to me when they were released...this beer was getting huge numbers at the time and I was excited to have it, and the excitement was replaced  by disbelief shortly after we opened the bottle...the nose was pretty weak, lacking the figs and caramel that i was looking to find...body was thin looking and light rust colored, flavor was yeasty and grassy which again i thought out of place for a quad.  overall, this beer was a huge letdown.

golden pour, looked like wine more than beer, aromawas yeast, a bit musty, apples, and citrus. flavor was sweet and apple, alot of carbonation, didnt havethe sour bite that a cantillon has, which i enjoyed...the flavor wasnt as good, but the drinkability was a little bit better imo.
